position_description_html:
Job Description

Duties


**********************************************************************************************************************************
AFSA actively promotes flexibility with working options in this role.
We encourage flexible work patterns and flex time options to support your family commitments and personal interests.
**********************************************************************************************************************************

The Senior Adviser Human Resources provides expert advice to business leaders and staff through a successful business partnering model to understand their unique requirements and develop best practice solutions. The Senior Adviser will manage a number of talent attraction and selection projects that are aligned to AFSA’s People Strategy 2020.

Key responsibilities include:

• Provide expert advice and lead best practice projects in areas such as:
- Talent attraction and selection
- Online Talent Management
- Diversity and Inclusion
- Organisation design
• Provide advice and expert interpretation on relevant legislation, policies, guidelines and processes so as to maximise compliance in employment related matters
• Engage and work collaboratively with internal stakeholders to provide advice on diverse human resource matters and practices
• Actively participate and contribute to the innovation and improvement of AFSA’s people management processes and practices, including conducting detailed research, and consolidating and evaluating data
• Manage and deliver talent attraction projects aligned to AFSA’s People Strategy 2020 to facilitate delivery of strategic goals
• Design, develop and manage intranet, internal and project communications to actively engage staff and managers with People & Capability initiatives

AFSA’s work environment

You will enjoy excellent conditions including generous superannuation (15.4%), a modern work environment, flexibility to balance work and personal life, and professional growth.
We encourage applications from Indigenous Australians, peoples from culturally diverse backgrounds and people with disabilities. We value employee commitment and contribution and we provide a working environment that supports staff to reach their full potential.

Eligibility


Please note that this opportunity is open only to Australian Citizens.

The successful applicant must have, or be willing to undergo a security clearance to the level of Baseline Vetting as a condition of employment.

To satisfy character requirements all AFSA employees must undergo a police records check.

Where a person has received a redundancy benefit from APS agency employment and their corresponding redundancy benefit period has not expired, they may be ineligible for employment.

Notes


Note: This position may be located in Sydney or Brisbane, based on the location of the successful Candidate.
Email applications should clearly state your name, the position title and location in the subject line.

Your application will be assessed against work related qualities and essential capabilities of the position and must include:
• A completed application cover sheet
• A current resume
• A covering letter (2 pages max) stating why you are interested in the position, how your skills and experience make you the best person for the position and what value you can add to AFSA and the People and Capability division

Candidates may be required to undergo psychometric and/or work sample testing as part of this selection process.

Non-ongoing opportunity will be offered for a specified term

Non-ongoing opportunity for 12 -18 months
